subject: p15446959
History: Patient with cough and metastatic lung cancer.
Findings: Mild opacity in the right lower lobe likely corresponds to an infectious process given the clinical concern. Follow up is recommended. Mild cardiomegaly and tortuous aorta are stable. Opacities in the left hemithorax are consistent with post-operative changes, better evaluated by prior CT from. There is no pneumothorax or increasing pleural effusions. Left hemidiaphragm is elevated as before. Left perihilar opacities, though difficult to evaluate, are grossly unchanged from prior study.
